ags:resource.dc:title: Spanish Trials Address Transport of Wild Tuna Juveniles for Ongoing Study
ags:resource.dc:subject: Thunnus thynnus
Bluefin tuna
domestication
ags:resource.dc:description: In work on the nutrition and feeding aspects of bluefin tuna, the authors utilize wild-caught juveniles that are adapted to culture conditions in sea cages. Challenges to the successful transportation of tuna juveniles are being addressed. Further trials are planned to transport tuna to tanks at the Spanish Institute of Oceanography for studies of the behavior and oxygen consumption of the fish.
ags:resource.dc:identifier: de la Gándara, F., A. Ortega. 2009. Spanish Trials Address Transport of Wild Tuna Juveniles for Ongoing Study. Global Aquaculture, March/April 2009: 73-74 pp.
